name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"de87dc5f-837e-4d49-a696-81539d27ec4e","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function: analyze_localfunction","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e0906b71-b377-4c53-9df2-c0e3038d0562","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"analyze_localfunction","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" function is a targeted analysis utility that processes a specific list of functions. Instead of traversing the entire Abstract Syntax Tree from the top down, it takes a list of pre-identified local functions and forces the analyzer to "enter" each one. It uses the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"pushStack","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" mechanism to switch context specifically into these functions, treating each as a significant entry point for analysis.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"430e5a14-eb03-47ad-9d36-e7a4127f1413","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Why this matters
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Static analysis tools often perform multiple passes over the code. In the first pass, the tool might identify all existing functions. In a second pass, it might need to analyze the bodies of specific functions to resolve types or side effects. This method provides the surgical precision required for that second pass. By marking these functions with ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"isEntry=True","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"pushStack","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", it signals that any side effects found during this analysis should be officially propagated to the surrounding environment once the function is "popped."","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3f2e5741-5969-45cc-b812-6f845d299ffd","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"How it works","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"648598b9-54d6-4b55-a5c1-5e8b2b58352a","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Iterate List:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It accepts a list of fully qualified namespaces for local functions (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"["main.auth.check_user", "main.utils.log"]","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"decc861a-3d6d-4642-9e81-a325db02cce9","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Lookup:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" For each name, it retrieves the corresponding ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Definition","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" object from the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"def_manager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b4be42b5-d872-4560-998b-f52ff45b0ec2","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Targeted Entry:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[{"id":"15721084-8e44-408e-9e6f-47330d4560b7","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It calls ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"pushStack(localDefi, isVisited=False, isEntry=True)","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1fa7b30e-5a3d-4411-a154-5b3ad2b21c96","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"isVisited=False","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ensures that the analyzer actually processes the code, even if it has seen the function before.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"24f2ccca-e0c2-4e5a-a696-de6a31fff88a","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"isEntry=True","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" tells the system that this function is a primary context, meaning its return values and side effects should be fully resolved and committed upon completion.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"05a4c094-2e7c-4e87-8804-447d967082ec","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Example Scenario
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Suppose the analyzer has finished the first pass of a module and found several complex functions it couldn't fully resolve. It might collect these into a ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"localList","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and call ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"analyze_localfunction","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to perform a deeper, dedicated analysis of just those functions to finalize their data flow maps.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f69ffb55-21ce-4bf0-ac9a-8bb9d7570853","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
